To contribute to the socio-economic development and poverty reduction in Zimbabwe through supporting agricultural related information collection, data quality control and analysis as well as outreach, capacity development, management and information dissemination. These should be attended in a way that can effectively and efficiently contribute to creating a sustainable, diversified, competitive and efficient agricultural sector that supports inclusive economic growth and revenue generation.

Category I Information Management Expert

  • Master’s degree in the fields of agriculture, Information management, international cooperation or equivalent. OR 12 years' professional experience in consultancy and management of programs/projects in the field of data systems analysis and management, policy and programming.
  • Extensive experience in information management systems, policy formulation and programming;
  • Strong background in agriculture and food security issues.
  • Experience in Southern Africa region and Zimbabwe in the above sectors wold be an added value.
  • Knowledge of the European Union instruments for ACP countries and of EDF procedures is a plus.

Category I Agricultural Statistics and Monitoring Expert

  • Master’s degree in the fields of agriculture, Statistics, Information management, Geographic information systems, Agricultural monitoring, Agro meteorology or equivalent. OR 12 years' professional experience in consultancy and management of programs/projects in the field of data systems analysis and management, policy and programming.
  • Extensive experience in agricultural statistics, information management systems, Geographic Information systems and mapping;
  • Strong background in agriculture and food security issues.
  • Experience in Southern Africa region and Zimbabwe in the above sectors would be an added value.

item.title: AWP 2 Projects Review
item.author: Bryan Schuetz
item.description:
The Beyond WTO Program (B-WTO) was developed in response to a request from the Government of Vietnam (GoV) for donor support to help with managing economic integration and the transition to a market economy following WTO accession. The B-WTO goal is “to strengthen government’s capacity to manage the integration of Vietnam into the global economy and the transition of Vietnam to a socialist market economy”. The immediate objective is “implementation of priority policy actions from the GoV’s Action Plan to enhance Vietnam’s capacity to sustain pro-poor growth (GAP)”.

The remit of this project was a review of the 2nd annual work plan’s implementation (AWP2) of Phase 2 of the B-WTO in May 2013. The objectives of the review were to:

  • Evaluate the project implementation performance and project results relative to the logical framework targets and evaluation criteria.
  • Evaluate the results achieved at the Component and Program’s level according to the Monitoring and Evaluation (M&E) framework of the Program.
  • Identify lessons learned from implementation, make recommendations for the remaining duration of the program and the Independent Completion Report process.
